author: Ambitocom
title: Está a dos horas de CABA y es un pueblo ideal para disfrutar de su verde y ver el atardecer desde sus bonitas costaneras
text:
La provincia de Buenos Aires ofrece muchas opciones para hacer una escapada durante el día. A pocos kilómetros de la ciudad, distintos pueblos y parajes permiten conectarse con la naturaleza y disfrutar de la tranquilidad de la vida de campo, desconectarse y degustar deliciosas comidas típicas.
El contenido al que quiere acceder es exclusivo para suscriptores.
suscribirse ya estoy suscripto Uno de ellos es San Pedro , un destino tranquilo, familiar y lleno de verde a unas dos horas de la Ciudad de Buenos Aires, a orillas de la costa del río Paraná. Originalmente fundada como Rincón de San Pedro Dávila de los Arrecifes, es una ciudad y puerto del interior de la Provincia de Buenos Aires. A continuación, te contamos qué podés hacer en un viaje exprés durante el día.
Informate más Polémica decisión en Venecia: duplican tasa turística para combatir exceso de visitantes El desconocido pueblo de Córdoba ideal para hacer trekking, montañismo y recorrer sus cavernas Qué actividades puedo hacer en San Pedro, Provincia de Buenos Aires Paseo por su costanera Las barrancas ofrecen vistas panorámicas al río Paraná desde distintos miradores ubicados en puntos estratégicos. Es un lindo recorrido para hacer tanto en auto como caminando, y desde donde se puede apreciar maravillosamente el atardecer.
Recorrer el casco histórico Incluye lugares como la Casa 1830, la Biblioteca Popular Rafael Obligado, el Museo Histórico, el Palacio Municipal, la Iglesia Nuestra Señora del Socorro, el Buque Museo Ara Irigoyen y otras casas coloniales.
Visita a El Parque Vuelta de Obligado Es el lugar en el que las fuerzas de la Confederación Argentina defendieron la soberanía nacional en 1845 . Hoy es un museo histórico y una reserva urbana con aves y bosques autóctonos.
Escalera de las Flores Una intervención urbana con mosaicos en más de 100 escalones con motivos inspirados en flores típicas de la zona: manzanillas, rosas, duraznillos de agua, nomeolvides y campanillas .
Probar la ensaimada, una parada obligatoria Comida típica del pueblo. Es una masa dulce en forma de espiral rellena con crema pastelera, originaria de Mallorca. En San Pedro viven muchos descendientes de familias mallorquinas, y la ensaimada se convirtió en un sello del lugar.
Cómo llegar a San Pedro, Provincia de Buenos Aires San Pedro está a unos 170 kilómetros de la Ciudad de Buenos Aires y a unos 140 de Rosario. Para acceder desde Caba, hay que tomar la Ruta Nacional 9 y la Ruta Provincial 1001. El viaje en auto se hace en unas dos horas.

author: 网易
title: AI辅助音乐创作，做有温度有情感的科技|算法|广州|人工智能|自然语言处理_网易订阅
text:
钟鹏 广州趣丸网络科技有限公司资深音频算法工程师 天谱乐AI音乐算法团队领头人
采写丨南都·琶洲π记者 何茵桃
图片丨受访者提供　　
人物名片：
钟鹏
广州趣丸网络科技有限公司资深音频算法工程师
天谱乐AI音乐算法团队领头人　　
被评选为琶洲领军算法师后，钟鹏表示：“这是对自己算法研究成果的肯定。技术的进步是无止境的，我们需要保持好奇心跟求知欲，继续探索与钻研。”
2022年初，钟鹏加入广州趣丸网络科技有限公司（后简称为“趣丸科技”）并带领团队进行天谱乐AI音乐大模型的自主研发和应用落地。天谱乐大模型是业界首个实现视频生音乐的多模态产品，能在短时间内生成达到出版级别的音乐作品，颠覆了传统版权音乐生产周期长、制作成本高的瓶颈。　　
天谱乐大模型
业界首个实现视频生音的多模态产品
研究生在读期间，钟鹏已经开始接触自然语言处理领域、情感分析方向的研究，即通过情感分析辅助抑郁症等心理疾病的治疗。这让钟鹏切身感受到人工智能的力量，他希望能用所学知识做出有温度的产品跟服务。
工作后，钟鹏从事自然语言处理与音频技术的研究，产出了如AI智能音箱、AI儿童故事机等产品。随后，钟鹏的研究方向扩展到了音乐理解与音乐生成。在他看来，语言能够传递意图，音乐则是表达情感。“音乐的复杂性远远超过了语言，音乐音频里任意细的震动与排列都代表不同的情绪，这十分吸引我。”
出于对音乐的热爱，钟鹏还自发学习吉他与尤克里里，这让他感觉到音乐是有门槛的。“我希望通过AIGC，让人人都能玩点音乐。”
2022年初，钟鹏加入了趣丸科技并参与了天谱乐大模型的研发。作为天谱乐AI音乐算法团队领头人，钟鹏带领团队进行天谱乐AI音乐大模型的自主研发和应用落地，围绕数据构建、数据标注、模型设计、模型训练评价等环节进行深耕跟探索。
天谱乐大模型采用业内领先的LLM音频域大模型技术方案，训练参数量多达4亿，可生成拟真度极高的专业级音乐成品。除了文生音、音生音，还突破性实现了视频生音功能，成为业界首个实现视频生音的多模态产品，能在短短1-2分钟内生成达到出版级别的音乐作品，突破了传统版权音乐生产周期长、制作成本高的瓶颈。
钟鹏发现，近两年大模型技术的发展对音乐生成领域带来了很多变化。以前AI音乐生成的技术链路主要以音乐符号生成为基础，从基础的作曲编曲入手，用生成式的算法结合规则的方式，先由算法生成曲谐，再利用歌声合成、伴奏生成、音频渲染等技术，将曲谐进行演绎，进而生成音乐音频。然而，这种方式会导致音乐的质量波动很大。
大模型技术发展后，对AI音乐生成的研究便转向音频域方向，这可以从音乐数据中发现并且总结规律，以端到端的方式实现完整的音乐生成。
尽管技术高速发展，但作为一种情感表达的艺术，音乐生成必须结合具体场景设计模型架构跟交互的方式。“因此我们从来不主张用AI音乐取代人类的创作，而是AI音乐辅助人类创作。”
AI技术不断选代
算法师需拓展更多技术链路
在钟鹏刚开始接触人工智能技术时，比较常见的是应用层的业务场景，比如说语音识别、图像识别。钟鹏称：“那时候感觉AI技术是非常有趣的，可以大大提高工作效率。”参与工作后，钟鹏转而从事展现层的业务场景，比如语音合成，这可以让技术与普通人实现交互。“将情感色彩赋予一个冰冷的机器，这非常吸引人。”
近几年，随着大模型技术的普及，生成式人工智能获得了更大维度的飞跃，拥有了分析和理解的能力。这让钟鹏觉得，让技术做出更多有温度的产品不再是空中楼阁。“AI技术不断选代，对现实的生活带来越来越多的影响，这正是AI的魅力所在。”
钟鹏分享道，作为音频算法工程师，需要有大量音乐相关的背景知识，才能将音乐生成工作做得更好。但是随着技术迭代，音频算法师学习的对象不仅局限于音乐音频。譬如天谱乐大模型的业务形态融合了文本、视频及图像的输入。因此，算法师还需关注自然语言处理、视频理解、图像分析等技术的融合。
钟鹏称：“作为这个时代背景下的算法工程师，除了深耕自己特定的领域外，我们还需拓展更多的技术链路。”
在第三届琶洲算法大赛上，钟鹏获评“琶洲领军算法师”。“非常感谢组委会的认可，”钟鹏说，“这也是对自己算法研究成果的肯定。技术的进步是无止境的，我们需要保持好奇心跟求知欲，继续探索与钻研。”
“海珠区评选琶洲领军算法师，为算法人才搭建了很好的人才培养与交流的平台，形成了一定的人才聚集效应，壮大了琶洲的算法人才队伍。同时算法大赛的赛制也吸引了很多优秀人才，不仅增强了琶洲在人工智能领域的影响力，也为琶洲扩宽了优质人才流入的空间。”钟鹏评价道。
谈到琶洲发展人工智能产业的优势，钟鹏称:“琶洲为大模型企业提供了很周到的政策服务与激励性的产业政策，为企业的发展解决了不少后顾之忧。其次，琶洲的算法生态建设很好，产业链比较完善，集算法、数据、政策、人才于一体，解决了企业在发展中面临的资金支持需求大、回购成本高、人才算力紧缺、商业落地难等痛点问题。”

author: Anonym
title: Christmas in Bethlehem: "It's very difficult to celebrate something while our people are dying" - Teller Report
text: A dark Christmas is coming to the Holy Land. No gigantic Christmas tree, no flamboyant nativity scene, little joy. A veil of sadness shrouded Bethlehem on Sunday, December 24, as it usually dresses up in its festive clothes for Christmas, tarnished this year by the war in the Gaza Strip. Few worshippers and tourists are expected during the day and at midnight mass in the Palestinian city in the occupied West Bank, which according to Christian tradition was the birthplace of Jesus Christ. Tourists have fled the area since the start of the war between Israel and Hamas on October 7. Palestinian Christians, for their part, do not have the heart for the celebrations, which have been largely cancelled by the municipality, as they cannot ignore the fate of their fellow citizens, besieged and bombed in Gaza. See alsoChrist in the Ruins: Christmas Festivities Cancelled in Bethlehem "Many of them are dying for this land, it's very difficult to celebrate something while our people are dying," said Nicole Najjar, an 18-year-old student, in the deserted Manger Square. In front of the Church of the Nativity, a work of art evoking the tragedy of Gaza has been installed on the ground, in place of the life-size nativity scene and the colossal Christmas tree: Mary and Joseph, grey statues, in the middle of a jumble of debris and sheet metal, behind barbed wire. On the building next door, a large banner reads: "Stop the genocide, stop the displacement, lift the blockade: the bells of Bethlehem are ringing for a ceasefire in Gaza." The war between Hamas and Israel entered its 79th day on Sunday. Triggered on October 7 by the Palestinian movement's commando attack in Israel, which killed about 1,140 people according to Israeli authorities, it has killed more than 20,400 people in Gaza and displaced 85 percent of the population, according to the Hamas government. Sadness and destruction In the Palestinian territory, which is governed by Hamas, an estimated number of a few thousand, Christians have taken refuge in churches that have not been spared from the fighting. Last week, a mother and daughter were killed by Israeli fire on the grounds of the Holy Family Church in Gaza City, according to the patriarchate. Pope Francis has denounced bombings and shootings targeting "defenseless civilians." "This year is different from others, it is made of sadness, sorrow, destruction, deprivation and loss," said Mervat Murra, a 50-year-old fashion designer in Bethlehem. The scout parade, which usually wakes up the city with bagpipes and tambourines, is to give way to a silent parade. In the morning, a huge Palestinian flag was unfurled in Manger Square, held at either end by adults and children, Christians and Muslims. Around the square, the Giacaman family opened their shop of nativity scenes and other objects of liturgical art for the first time since October 8, without illusions. "No one will come, we opened because we have to, it's Christmas," said Amir Giacaman, 29. "During Covid, we had two bad years but it's nothing compared to that." "We don't like to celebrate when Gaza is experiencing genocide and even here in the West Bank we mourn young people killed by Israelis and other detainees every day," Mitri Raheb, pastor of a Lutheran church in Bethlehem, told AFP. Hostilities in Gaza have spilled over into the West Bank, Palestinian territory occupied by Israel since 1967, where more than 300 Palestinians have been killed by Israeli forces since 7 October. "All we want for Christmas is a ceasefire, a lasting one, to put an end to this atrocity," Raheb said. "Bethlehem gave Jesus to the world. It is high time for the world to bring peace to Bethlehem and Gaza." With AFP This week's recapFrance 24 invites you to look back on the news that marked the week Subscribe now Take international news with you wherever you go! Download the France 24 app

author: Emily Van de Riet
title: Fire department welcomes 15 babies in 1 year: ‘That has to be a record somewhere’
text:
YUBA CITY, Calif. (Gray News) – A fire department in California is celebrating the birth of a whopping 15 babies this year.
In a Facebook post , Yuba City firefighters shared a photo of all 15 dads holding their new babies, all born over the last year.
“15 babies in 1 year! That has to be a record somewhere lol!” the department captioned the photo.
The firefighters posed together with their babies for the group photo during the department’s annual Breakfast with Santa event on Dec. 11.
Yuba City is located about 40 miles north of Sacramento.
